resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: Computational analysis of 10,860 phenotypic annotations in individuals with SCN2A-related disorders

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: fam1204
Patient age: Unknown
Patient sex: Unknown
Patient features: Generalized hypotonia, Global developmental delay, Infantile spasms, Arachnoid cyst, Motor delay, Cerebral palsy, Dysphagia, Epileptic encephalopathy, Hypermetropia, Bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges, EEG with generalized slow activity, EEG with spike-wave complexes, Feeding difficulties, Hypsarrhythmia.
Excluded patient features: None.

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"search_terms":["Generalized hypotonia","Global developmental delay","Infantile spasms","Arachnoid cyst","Motor delay","Cerebral palsy","Dysphagia","Epileptic encephalopathy","Hypermetropia","Bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges","EEG with generalized slow activity","EEG with spike-wave complexes","Feeding difficulties","Hypsarrhythmia"]}

messages.name: search

function.name: run_query
function.arguments: {"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) WHERE p.id IN ['HP:0001290','HP:0001263','HP:0012469','HP:0100702','HP:0001270','HP:0002015','HP:0200134','HP:0000540','HP:0011189','HP:0010845','HP:0010850','HP:0011968','HP:0002521'] WITH d, count(p) AS matched_features ORDER BY matched_features DESC LIMIT 20 RETURN d, matched_features"}

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011964', 'caption': 'DPAGT1-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'name': 'DPAGT1-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'description': 'DPAGT1-CDG is a form of congenital disorders of N-linked glycosylation characterized by hypotonia, intractable seizures, developmental delay, microcephaly and severe fetal hypokinesia. Additional features that may be observed include apnea and respiratory deficiency, cataracts, joint contractures, vermian hypoplasia, dysmorphic features (esotropia, arched palate, micrognathia, finger clinodactyly, single flexion creases) and feeding difficulties. The disease is caused by loss-of-function mutations in the gene DPAGT1 (11q23.3).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0007298', 'caption': 'spinocerebellar ataxia type 29', 'name': 'spinocerebellar ataxia type 29', 'description': 'Spinocerebellar ataxia type 29 (SCA29) is a rare subtype of autosomal dominant cerebellar ataxia type I (ADCA type I) characterized by very slowly progressive or non-progressive ataxia, dysarthria, oculomotor abnormalities and intellectual disability.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010396', 'caption': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 2', 'name': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 2', 'description': 'Any early infantile epileptic encephalopathy in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CDKL5 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0007113', 'caption': 'Angelman syndrome', 'name': 'Angelman syndrome', 'description': 'A neurogenetic disorder characterized by severe intellectual deficit and distinct facial dysmorphic features.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0009723', 'caption': 'Leigh syndrome', 'name': 'Leigh syndrome', 'description': 'A progressive neurological disease defined by specific neuropathological features associating brainstem and basal ganglia lesions.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011830', 'caption': 'lissencephaly due to LIS1 mutation', 'name': 'lissencephaly due to LIS1 mutation', 'description': 'Lissencephaly due to LIS1 mutation is a cerebral malformation with epilepsy characterized predominantly by posterior isolated lissencephaly with developmental delay, intellectual disability and epilepsy that usually evolves from West syndrome to Lennox-Gastaut syndrome. Additional features include muscular hypotonia, acquired microcephaly, failure to thrive and poor control of airways leading to aspiration pneumonia.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014741', 'caption': 'DeSanto-Shinawi syndrome due to WAC point mutation', 'name': 'DeSanto-Shinawi syndrome due to WAC point mutation', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014855', 'caption': 'intellectual disability, autosomal dominant 42', 'name': 'intellectual disability, autosomal dominant 42', 'description': 'Any autosomal dominant intellectual disability in which the cause of the disease is a heterozygous mutation in the GNB1 gene. It is characterized by global developmental delay, intellectual disability, hypotonia, structural brain abnormalities, and seizures. Other less common findings include dystonia, visual impairment, behavior problems, growth delay, craniofacial defects, and genitourinary abnormalities in males.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011652', 'caption': 'Phelan-McDermid syndrome', 'name': 'Phelan-McDermid syndrome', 'description': 'A rare genetic neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by neonatal hypotonia, global developmental delay, normal to accelerated growth, absent to severely delayed speech, and minor dysmorphic features. Phelan-McDermid syndrome can be caused by a deletion at chromosome 22q13 or by mutation in the SHANK3 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014725', 'caption': 'spastic tetraplegia-thin corpus callosum-progressive postnatal microcephaly syndrome', 'name': 'spastic tetraplegia-thin corpus callosum-progressive postnatal microcephaly syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014921', 'caption': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 43', 'name': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 43', 'description': 'Any early infantile epileptic encephalopathy in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the GABRB3 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010472', 'caption': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 36', 'name': 'developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 36', 'category': 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010478', 'caption': 'SLC35A2-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'name': 'SLC35A2-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'description': 'SLC35A2-CDG is a congenital disorder of glycosylation characterized by severe or profound global developmental delay, early epileptic encephalopathy, muscular hypotonia, dysmorphic features (coarse facies, thick eyebrows, broad nasal bridge, thick lips, inverted nipples), variable ocular defects and brain morphological abnormalities on brain MRI (cerebral atrophy, thin corpus callosum).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0060752', 'caption': 'neurodevelopmental disorder with spasticity and poor messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the patient's features—generalized hypotonia, global developmental delay, infantile spasms, arachnoid cyst, motor delay, cerebral palsy, dysphagia, epileptic encephalopathy, hypermetropia, bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges, EEG abnormalities (generalized slow activity, spike-wave complexes, hypsarrhythmia), and feeding difficulties—the following are the most likely diagnoses, ranked by the number of matching features:

1. [DPAGT1-congenital disorder of glycosylation](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0011964): Characterized by hypotonia, intractable seizures, developmental delay, microcephaly, and feeding difficulties.
2. [Spinocerebellar ataxia type 29](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0007298): Presents with ataxia, intellectual disability, and developmental delay.
3. [Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy, 2 (CDKL5-related)](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0010396): Early infantile epileptic encephalopathy with developmental delay and seizures.
4. [Angelman syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0007113): Severe intellectual disability, seizures, and characteristic EEG findings.
5. [Leigh syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0009723): Progressive neurological disease with developmental delay and hypotonia.
6. [Lissencephaly due to LIS1 mutation](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0011830): Cerebral malformation with epilepsy, hypotonia, and developmental delay.
7. [DeSanto-Shinawi syndrome due to WAC point mutation](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014741): Neurodevelopmental disorder with hypotonia and developmental delay.
8. [Intellectual disability, autosomal dominant 42 (GNB1-related)](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014855): Global developmental delay, hypotonia, seizures, and brain abnormalities.
9. [Phelan-McDermid syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0011652): Neonatal hypotonia, global developmental delay, and feeding difficulties.
10. [Spastic tetraplegia-thin corpus callosum-progressive postnatal microcephaly syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014725): Features include spasticity, microcephaly, and developmental delay.

These disorders are all associated with multiple features present in your patient. The most likely diagnosis, based on the number and specificity of matching features, is DPAGT1-congenital disorder of glycosylation, but further clinical and genetic evaluation would be necessary for confirmation.

If you would like more details on any of these conditions or wish to explore additional possible diagnoses, please let me know!
